main event: An observer reported seeing a gray object heading southwest at an altitude of approximately 20,000 feet near Lynchburg, Virginia on May 12, 1966.
interesting points: The object was reported to be silent, with no visible contrail,Conflicting data exists regarding the object's speed and shape, which were not consistent throughout the report,The observer initially described it as an aircraft approaching Lynchburg airport,The sighting lasted a significant amount of time without the observer being able to confirm the object's true nature,The object was estimated to have a speed between 120-300 mph.
